Business Plan for Implementing a TMS for Research Database and Discovery Information Services

Executive Summary:
Our company is planning to implement a Translation Management System (TMS) for our Research Database and Discovery Information Services platform to enable global readiness and multilingual deployment. The TMS will allow us to streamline the translation process and ensure consistent and accurate translations across all languages. By implementing a TMS, we aim to improve customer satisfaction, increase efficiency, and reduce costs associated with the translation process.

Market Analysis:
The global market for research databases and discovery information services is growing rapidly, with increasing demand for multilingual support as companies expand into new markets. As a result, there is a need for an efficient and effective translation management system to ensure accurate and consistent translations across all languages. Our TMS will meet this need and help our platform to become more competitive in the global marketplace.

Target Market:
Our target market for this TMS is global companies that require multilingual support for their research and discovery information services. This includes academic institutions, government agencies, research organizations, and other businesses that rely on research databases and discovery information services.

Key Features and Benefits:
The TMS we plan to implement will have the following key features and benefits:

* Integration with our existing platform: The TMS will seamlessly integrate with our existing platform, allowing for a smooth and efficient translation process.
* Automated translation workflows: The TMS will automate many aspects of the translation process, reducing the need for manual intervention and improving efficiency.
* Quality control and consistency: The TMS will ensure that translations are of high quality and consistent across all languages, improving customer satisfaction and reducing errors.
* Centralized management: The TMS will provide a centralized location for managing all translations, making it easier to track progress and manage the translation process.
* Collaboration tools: The TMS will include collaboration tools, allowing translators and reviewers to work together more effectively and efficiently.
* Reporting and analytics: The TMS will provide reporting and analytics capabilities, allowing us to track key metrics and improve the translation process over time.

Implementation Plan:
The implementation plan for the TMS will be as follows:

1. Define requirements: We will work with key stakeholders to define the requirements for the TMS, including the languages to be supported, workflows, and integration with our existing platform.
2. Select a vendor: We will evaluate potential TMS vendors based on their features, pricing, and support, and select the vendor that best meets our needs.
3. Configuration and customization: Once a vendor is selected, we will work with them to configure and customize the TMS to meet our specific needs.
4. Training: We will provide training to our staff and any external translators and reviewers who will be using the TMS.
5. Testing and QA: We will conduct extensive testing and quality assurance to ensure that the TMS is working as expected and that translations are of high quality.
6. Rollout: Once testing is complete, we will rollout the TMS to our platform and begin using it to manage translations.

Financial Plan:
The financial plan for the TMS will include the following:

* Implementation costs: This will include the cost of the TMS vendor, configuration and customization, training, and testing and QA.
* Ongoing costs: This will include the cost of ongoing maintenance and support for the TMS, as well as any translation costs associated with using the TMS.
* ROI: We expect to see a significant ROI from implementing the TMS, including cost savings from improved efficiency, increased revenue from improved customer satisfaction, and a competitive advantage in the global marketplace.
